data.title: Alam Anda Ocean Front Resort & Spa
data.meta_description: Learn all about Alam Anda Ocean Front Resort & Spa in Bali. Discover rooms, reviews, photos & special rates!
data.text:
Destination: Indonesia

Singaraja-Amlapura, Sambirenteng, Kec. Tejakula, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali, Indonesia 81173 | Room from $42/ppn

alam anda ocean front resort Quick Pitch

Alam Anda Ocean Front Resort & Spa, nestled along the untouched north-east coast of Bali, offers a haven of tranquility and natural beauty. Set against the backdrop of volcanic rock beaches and surrounded by swaying palm trees, this oasis is a sanctuary far removed from the bustling tourist areas. Welcoming guests as cherished friends, the resort is committed to providing a warm and pampering experience, ensuring that every visitor feels at home.

Quick Information

No of Rooms: 29

Dive Center: On-site

Amenities: Swimming pool, restaurant, spa, gym and more!

Internet: Yes, free

Nearest Airport: Ngurah Rai Airport

Airport shuttle: Yes, surcharge

How to Get There

Travelers making their way to Alam Anda Ocean Front Resort & Spa on Bali's north-east coast can seamlessly access the resort through the hote's shuttle service that starts at the Denpasar Airport (Ngurah Rai Airport.) The shuttle service provides a picturesque three-hour ride from the airport to the resort. During this scenic journey, visitors are treated to an introduction to Bali's stunning landscapes, traditional villages, and the island's rich cultural diversity.

Dive Overview

Diving in Bali offers an extraordinary underwater adventure within the heart of the Coral Triangle, celebrated for its rich marine biodiversity. The island boasts diverse dive sites catering to various preferences, from the renowned USAT Liberty shipwreck in Tulamben to the manta rays and impressive Mola Mola in Nusa Penida. With optimal diving conditions, including good visibility and warm waters year-round, Bali's underwater landscapes feature vibrant coral gardens, steep drop-offs, and captivating marine life.

[Read More: Bali Dive Travel Guide]

Back to Menu

Accommodations

Types of Rooms, Amenities and Photos

ALAM ANDA OCEAN FRONT RESORT Room Overview

Each accommodation type at Alam Anda Resort is designed to cater to different preferences, ensuring a diverse range of options for guests seeking comfort, luxury, and a unique Balinese experience.

Losmen

The Losmen category offers two simple yet charmingly furnished rooms. Each room spans approximately 25 sqm, including a small terrace. Decorated in typical Balinese style with teak wood, the rooms feature a double bed, fan, air conditioning, desk with chair, and a minibar. The 6 sqm bathroom includes a shower and Western toilet.

Baruna

Similar to Losmen rooms, the Baruna provides comparable facilities but with a distinct entrance and a private garden, offering a more authentic "Bali feeling." The living area is about 40 sqm and includes a double bed, air conditioning, fan, safe, desk, shower room, and an indoor couch. A small terrace with Balinese outdoor sofa enhances the overall experience.

SeaView Bungalows

Nine SeaView Bungalows, constructed with palm wood, mahogany, and bamboo, offer a unique and exclusive experience. Elevated on stilts, each bungalow provides a 40 sqm living area with a terrace, exclusive bamboo or rattan furnishings, and a "cuddle meadow" on the veranda. The 10 sqm marble bathroom adds a touch of luxury, and amenities include air conditioning, ceiling fan, minibar, and a safe deposit box.

Deluxe Garden Bungalows

Twelve Deluxe Garden Bungalows are nestled in a tropical garden, offering a spacious retreat of 50 sqm. Built with quality materials such as palm wood, mahogany, and bamboo, the bungalows feature a living/bedroom, minibar, and a bathroom with shower/WC. Air conditioning ensures comfort, and some bungalows in the back row offer an additional sofa bed for a third person.

Villa Ambu-Ambu

This Balinese-style villa, located directly on the sea with the best sea view, covers approximately 85 sqm. It features two bedrooms, each with its own outdoor bathroom. The villa includes a private garden of about 1,000 sqm, air conditioning, a locker, and an inviting garden with sun loungers and a hammock.

Villa Purnama

Meaning "full moon," Villa Purnama offers a unique living space of 160 sqm. It includes an open-plan living room, a private garden, and a dedicated pool. With three air-conditioned bedrooms, each with its own bathroom, the villa stands out as the only accommodation with TV facilities in the living room.

Villa Bahari

Two detached Bahari Villas, each with its own swimming pool, are located at the western end of the resort with direct access to the sea. These villas, suitable for two to four guests, feature two bedrooms with private bathrooms, large roofed verandas, and a beachfront garden with sunbathing areas.

Villa Lumba-Lumba

Described as "Luxury made by Alam Anda," Villa Lumba-Lumba is a detached villa with 110 sqm of living space and a private shoreline. It includes two bedrooms, open bathrooms, a gazebo, terrace, private swimming pool, and a four-poster bed with sea views. The villa offers a serene retreat with various amenities.

ALAM ANDA OCEAN FRONT RESORT Food & Drinks

Alam Anda Ocean Front Resort takes pride in offering a delightful fusion of Indonesian and Western cuisine, incorporating both local and international flavors. Guests can indulge in a diverse dining experience with meals served a la carte and through themed buffets, allowing them to explore an array of culinary delights. The resort is attentive to specific dietary requirements, and with prior notice, the culinary team is dedicated to accommodating various preferences to ensure a personalized and enjoyable dining experience for all guests.

Packages & Rates

Dive Information & Itineraries

diving in bali

Diving in Bali is an enchanting and world-renowned experience that draws underwater enthusiasts from across the globe. Situated within the Coral Triangle, a global epicenter of marine biodiversity, Bali boasts an extraordinary variety of marine life and vibrant coral reefs. The island's dive sites cater to divers of all levels, offering a diverse range of underwater landscapes, from thriving coral gardens to steep drop-offs and captivating shipwrecks.

One of Bali's iconic dive destinations is Tulamben, home to the USAT Liberty shipwreck, a fascinating underwater relic draped in colorful corals and teeming with marine life. Nusa Penida, another highlight, is famous for its encounters with majestic manta rays and the elusive Mola Mola, or sunfish, during the season.

Bali's north-east coast, where Alam Anda Ocean Front Resort is located, provides easy access to some of the island's top dive sites. The house reef directly in front of the resort serves as a marine conservation area, ensuring a pristine underwater environment and offering divers a chance to explore its diverse ecosystem.

Diving conditions in Bali are generally favorable year-round, with warm waters and good visibility. The island's unique geographical features contribute to a variety of dive sites with distinct characteristics, making it an ideal destination for both beginners and experienced divers.

[Read More: Bali Dive Travel Guide]

Back to Menu

Dive Center Information

ALAM ANDA OCEAN FRONT RESORT Dive Center Overview

Mavi Diving, situated a mere 50 meters from the beach at Alam Anda Ocean Front Resort & Spa, stands as a premier diving center offering unparalleled access to Bali's mesmerizing underwater wonders. The center's strategic location ensures the utmost convenience for divers of all levels, allowing them to seamlessly transition from their accommodations to the diving center. Boasting a well-equipped facility, Mavi Diving provides a comprehensive array of reliable diving equipment, catering to both beginners and experienced divers.

At the heart of the diving experience is the resort's house reef, a designated conservation area where Mavi Diving facilitates exploration of a thriving and diverse underwater ecosystem. The center is not only committed to providing educational diving courses, led by qualified instructors, but also to fostering responsible and sustainable diving practices that contribute to the preservation of Bali's marine life and coral reefs. With strategic access to some of Bali's top dive sites, including Tulamben and Nusa Penida, Mavi Diving ensures that guests can embark on enriching day trips to explore the varied underwater landscapes Bali has to offer.
